intro: Euphrasia collina var. speciosa, commonly known as the showy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy yellow flowers with prominent dark veins. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in early summer. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
